conversations.content: A Joyous Encore: Part One
To my friend,  Hey there! How are you doing? I'm great, of course—except for times when I smile to hide the pain.
Anyway, let me fill you in on the current state of my frightful tale.
Some time ago, a silver-tongued liar said that my voice could lead both sailors and ships to their doom beneath the waves.
While I was busy crying, that lie came to be accepted as truth. After that...I was lost.
My great songs became a tiny hum. I sang only on the loneliest beaches or in the deepest ocean abyss where none could hear my words.
But it was better than hurting others, because if I DID hurt someone else, it would be no different than if I wounded myself directly.
It was a frightful, sad existence, and yet all I could do was laugh— for my nightly song had become a recital for the lonesome ocean wind.
But one day, a prince heard my song and came to me with an open hand.
He led me out of the depths and onto the land, where the radiance of the sun was more dazzling than I had ever dared to remember.
Yet while I languished at the bottom of the sea, the world had spun on. Births. Deaths. Every tiny moment of life. I had missed them all.
But to give up now would be even worse, so I'll continue to a place I cannot reach by my feet alone.
I reject that frightful tale, and raise the curtain on a new story of my own!
A Joyous Encore: Part Two
After a prince appeared and saved me from my lonely existence, I set out to create a new story of my own.
The prince and his friends built a stage for me. For ME! And yet, when I tried to step out on it, I found myself trembling with fright.
I couldn't bear to look out at the crowd, and so I closed my eyes tight. It was as if I'd never left the lightless depths at the bottom of the ocean.
But all my new friends urged me on, so I swallowed my fear and stepped out onto that great, wide stage with my heart hammering in my chest.
When I opened my eyes, I was blinded by the radiant smiles of the crowd. It was its own kind of ocean, but one I'd never seen in all my life.
The curtain rose, and my story began! Now come with me as I sing us to our very own happy ending!
When I sing, they call my name. When I smile, they smile too. My song will never again turn to seafoam on the lonely waves!
Don't let the music stop! This joyous encore NEVER ends!
Though you cannot hear my voice, I know my smile shines through. That gives me strength to carry on and once again find you.
Whether in the lonely ocean, or a massive galaxy, I will find my way to you as if carried by the sea.
Until the day we meet again I'll sing my song anew! I'll sing this song of love and joy until I can find you!
